intro: Solanum curtipes, commonly known as the slender nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small, bell-shaped, and typically white or pale green, with five lobes. Solanum curtipes produces small, berry-like fruits that are yellow when mature and contain several seeds.
